sadness.quote: Death makes equal the high and low
sadness.author: John Heywood

sadness.quote: The hardest thing you overcome are the ones that give the most meaning
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: The fear of death is the beginning of slavery
sadness.author: Robert Anton Wilson

sadness.quote: Death is the ultimate boundary of human matters
sadness.author: Horace

sadness.quote: Though death be poor, it ends a mortal woe
sadness.author: William Shakespeare

sadness.quote: Death takes no bribes
sadness.author: Benjamin Franklin

sadness.quote: Death is never an apology
sadness.author: Soul King

sadness.quote: Because I have loved life, I shall have no sorrow to die
sadness.author: Amelia Burr

sadness.quote: Religion is the human response to being alive and having to die
sadness.author: Forrest Church

sadness.quote: Life has more meaning in the face of death
sadness.author: Robert Greene

sadness.quote: In my end is my beginning
sadness.author: Mary, Queen of Scots

sadness.quote: The phoenix must burn to emerge
sadness.author: Janet Fitch

sadness.quote: Everyone dies. But not everyone really lives
sadness.author: Unknown

sadness.quote: The meaning of life is that it stops
sadness.author: Franz Kafka

sadness.quote: It’s better to burn out than to fade away
sadness.author: Neil Young

sadness.quote: Every exit is an entry somewhere else
sadness.author: Tom Stoppard

sadness.quote: Nothing is ever certain
sadness.author: Alice Sebold

sadness.quote: No art is possible without a dance with death
sadness.author: Kurt Vonnegut

sadness.quote: Everyone dies but not everyone lives
sadness.author: William Wallace

sadness.quote: I shall not die of a cold. I shall die of having lived
sadness.author: Willa Cather

sadness.quote: Life without an ideal is spiritual death
sadness.author: Emma Goldman

sadness.quote: The idea is to die young as late as possible
sadness.author: Ashley Montagu

sadness.quote: Life is like a very short visit to a toy shop between birth and death
sadness.author: Desmond Morris

sadness.quote: It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live
sadness.author: Victor Hugo

sadness.quote: Even trees do not die without a groan
sadness.author: Henry David Thoreau

sadness.quote: The highest tribute to the dead is not grief but gratitude
sadness.author: Thornton Wilder

sadness.quote: Let life be beautiful like summer flowers and death like autumn leaves
sadness.author: Rabindranath Tagore

sadness.quote: Death is not extinguishing the light; it is only putting out the lamp because the dawn has come
sadness.author: Rabindranath Tagore

sadness.quote: If life must not be taken too seriously, then so neither must death
sadness.author: Samuel Butler

sadness.quote: The day which we fear as our last is but the birthday of eternity
sadness.author: Seneca

sadness.quote: Keep the prospect of death, exile, and all such apparent tragedies before you every day – especially death – and you will never have an abject thought, or desire anything to excess
sadness.author: Epictetus

sadness.quote: By becoming deeply aware of our mortality, we intensify our experience of every aspect of life
sadness.author: Robert Greene

sadness.quote: I wanted a perfect ending. Now I’ve learned, the hard way, that some poems don’t rhyme, and some stories don’t have a clear beginning, middle, and end. Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what’s going to happen next. Delicious ambiguity
sadness.author: Gilda Radner

sadness.quote: I discovered to my joy, that it is life, not death, that has no limits
sadness.author: Gabriel García Márquez

sadness.quote: It’s only when we truly know and understand that we have a limited time on earth – and that we have no way of knowing when our time is up – that we will begin to live each day to the fullest, as if it was the only one we had
sadness.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

sadness.quote: Death? Be as proud as you want: bore me later, because Love is sovereign here. Life never ends. Joy comes in the morning. Glory hallelujah. And let it be so
sadness.author: Anne Lamott

sadness.quote: Those men who, in war, seek to preserve their lives at any rate commonly die with shame and ignominy, while those who look upon death as common to all, and unavoidable, and are only solicitous to die with honour, oftener arrive at old age and, while they live, live happier
sadness.author: Xenophon

sadness.quote: Try as much as possible to be wholly alive with all your might, and when you laugh, laugh like hell. And when you get angry, get good and angry. Try to be alive. You will be dead soon enough
sadness.author: William Saroyan

sadness.quote: Let children walk with Nature, let them see the beautiful blendings and communions of death and life, their joyous inseparable unity, as taught in woods and meadows, plains and mountains and streams of our blessed star, and they will learn that death is stingless indeed, and as beautiful as life
sadness.author: John Muir

sadness.quote: I would rather die a meaningful death than to live a meaningless life
sadness.author: Corazon Aquino

sadness.quote: When we finally know we are dying, and all other sentient beings are dying with us, we start to have a burning, almost heartbreaking sense of the fragility and preciousness of each moment and each being, and from this can grow a deep, clear, limitless compassion for all beings
sadness.author: Sogyal Rinpoche

sadness.quote: Death is not the biggest fear we have; our biggest fear is taking the risk to be alive – the risk to be alive and express what we really are
sadness.author: Miguel Angel Ruiz

sadness.quote: Yea, all things live forever, though at times they sleep and are forgotten. H
sadness.author: Rider Haggard

sadness.quote: Good men must die, but death cannot kill their names
sadness.author: Unknown (Submitted by the Wisdom Quotes Community)

sadness.quote: When he shall die, take him and cut him out in little stars, and he will make the face of heaven so fine that all the world will be in love with night and pay no worship to the garish sun
sadness.author: William Shakespeare (Romeo and Juliet)

sadness.quote: The man who lives without conflict, who lives with beauty and love, is not frightened of death because to love is to die
sadness.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

sadness.quote: Birth and death are the most singular events we experience – and the contemplation of death, as of birth, should be a thing of beauty, not ignobility. Jacob K
sadness.author: Javits

sadness.quote: There is only one god and his name is Death, and there is only one thing we say to Death: ‘Not today’
sadness.author: Syrio Forel (Games Of Thrones)

sadness.quote: Do not fear death. Death is always at our side. When we show fear, it jumps at us faster than light. But, if we do not show fear, it casts its eye upon us gently and then guides us into infinity
sadness.author: Laughing Bull

sadness.quote: Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one’s head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no to-morrow. To forget time, to forget life, to be at peace
sadness.author: Oscar Wilde

sadness.quote: Here is the test to find whether your mission on Earth is finished: if you’re alive, it isn’t
sadness.author: Richard Bach

sadness.quote: A word is dead when it is said, some say. I say it just begins to live that day
sadness.author: Emily Dickinson

sadness.quote: After your death, you will be what you were before your birth
sadness.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

sadness.quote: Death ends a life, not a relationship
sadness.author: Mitch Albom

sadness.quote: Neither the sun, nor death can be looked at steadily
sadness.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

sadness.quote: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory
sadness.author: Antonio Porchia

sadness.quote: The first breath is the beginning of death
sadness.author: Thomas Fuller

sadness.quote: Death, for instance, is nothing terrible, but the terrible thing is the opinion that death is terrible
sadness.author: Epictetus

sadness.quote: Life isn’t fair, nor should you expect it to be. No matter how well you prepare, shit will happen, often when you least expect it
sadness.author: Ed Latimore

sadness.quote: It is human to have your soul brought to a crisis you did not anticipate
sadness.author: The Dune Series

sadness.quote: This aspect of reality, this weird scary aspect of life, can just wreck everything if you don’t figure out at some point that it is what makes life so profound, meaningful, rich, complex, wild
sadness.author: Anne Lamott

sadness.quote: I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it
sadness.author: Mark Twain

sadness.quote: Success is failure recycled. Life is death reborn
sadness.author: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

sadness.quote: The world would be dramatically better if everyone had to experience a near death event growing up. Everyone will instantly value their time more, and be happier
sadness.author: @TheChuChu_

sadness.quote: Everything is ridiculous if one thinks of death
sadness.author: Thomas Bernhard

sadness.quote: Take nothing for granted. Keep in mind that it can come at anytime. Even today
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: Whether or not there’s an afterlife, screw it. Just live your life right here right now before it’s too late
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure to the world
sadness.author: John Steinbeck

sadness.quote: Part 1. I despise wisdom and the blessings of this world. It is all worthless, fleeting, illusory, and deceptive, like a mirage
sadness.author: Anton Chekhov

sadness.quote: Part 2. You may be proud, wise, and fine, but death will wipe you off the face of the earth as though you were no more than mice burrowing under the floor, and your posterity, your history, your immortal geniuses will burn or freeze together with the earthly globe
sadness.author: Anton Chekhov

sadness.quote: Death is the true inspiring genius, or the muse of philosophy… Indeed without death men would scarcely philosophize
sadness.author: Arthur Schopenhauer (The World as Will and Representation)

sadness.quote: Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity. They seem to be more afraid of life than death. James F
sadness.author: Byrnes

sadness.quote: Death is a stripping away of all that is not you. The secret of life is to "die before you die" – and find that there is no death
sadness.author: Eckhart Tolle

sadness.quote: In the end one needs more courage to live than to kill himself
sadness.author: Albert Camus

sadness.quote: Men are never really willing to die except for the sake of freedom: therefore they do not believe in dying completely
sadness.author: Albert Camus

sadness.quote: If you gave someone your heart and they died, did they take it with them? Did you spend the rest of forever with a hole inside you that couldn’t be filled?
sadness.author: Jodi Picoult

sadness.quote: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?
sadness.author: Jodi Picoult

sadness.quote: Parting is all we know of heaven, and all we need of hell
sadness.author: Emily Dickinson

sadness.quote: The death of a beloved is an amputation. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis

sadness.quote: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings
sadness.author: Socrates

sadness.quote: The hour of departure has arrived, and we go our separate ways, I to die, and you to live. Which of these two is better only God knows
sadness.author: Socrates

sadness.quote: Death is only the end if you assume the story is about you
sadness.author: Welcome to Night Vale (Podcast)

sadness.quote: You want to live – but do you know how to live? You are scared of dying – and, tell me, is the kind of life you lead really any different from being dead?
sadness.author: Seneca

sadness.quote: We are all alone, born alone, die alone, and—in spite of True Romance magazines — we shall all someday look back on our lives and see that, in spite of our company, we were alone the whole way. Hunter S
sadness.author: Thompson

sadness.quote: Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing, doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before
sadness.author: Edgar Allan Poe

sadness.quote: The idea of a good society is something you do not need a religion and eternal punishment to buttress; you need a religion if you are terrified of death
sadness.author: Gore Vidal

sadness.quote: I have wrestled with death. It is the most unexciting contest you can imagine. It takes place in an impalpable greyness, with nothing underfoot, with nothing around, without spectators, without clamour, without glory, without the great desire of victory, without the great fear of defeat, in a sickly atmosphere of tepid skepticism, without much belief in your own right, and still less in that of your adversary
sadness.author: Joseph Conrad

sadness.quote: Absolute silence leads to sadness. It is the image of death
sadness.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

sadness.quote: Sing your death song, and die like a hero going home
sadness.author: Tecumseh

sadness.quote: Death is beautiful when seen to be a law, and not an accident
sadness.author: Henry David Thoreau

sadness.quote: Anything I’ve done that was ultimately worthwhile initially scared me to death
sadness.author: Betty Bender

sadness.quote: We owe respect to the living; to the dead we owe only truth
sadness.author: Voltaire

sadness.quote: The harder the pain, the longer the path to recovery, the better the opportunity to learn
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: Death: something like birth, a natural mystery, elements that split and recombine. Not an embarrassing thing. Not an offense to reason, or our nature
sadness.author: Marcus Aurelius

sadness.quote: All good is hard. All evil is easy. Dying, losing, cheating, and mediocrity is easy. Stay away from easy
sadness.author: Scott Alexander

sadness.quote: I could just remember how my father used to say that the reason for living was to get ready to stay dead a long time
sadness.author: William Faulkner

sadness.quote: What is history? Its beginning is that of the centuries of systematic work devoted to the solution of the enigma of death, so that death itself may eventually be overcome. That is why people write symphonies, and why they discover mathematical infinity and electromagnetic waves
sadness.author: Boris Pasternak

sadness.quote: For life be, after all, only a waitin’ for somethin’ else than what we’re doin’; and death be all that we can rightly depend on
sadness.author: Bram Stoker (Dracula)

sadness.quote: Losing your life is not the worst thing that can happen. The worst thing is to lose your reason for living
sadness.author: Jo Nesbø

sadness.quote: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous, possessive love that grabs at what it can. But life leaps over oblivion lightly, losing only a thing or two of no importance, and gloom is just a passing shadow of a cloud
sadness.author: Yann Martel (Life of Pi)

sadness.quote: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don’t know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings
sadness.author: Anais Nin

sadness.quote: Death destroys a man: the idea of Death saves him. E.M
sadness.author: Forster

sadness.quote: Die happily and look forward to taking up a new and better form. Like the sun, only when you set in the west can you rise in the east
sadness.author: Rumi

sadness.quote: That’s what literature is
sadness.author: It’s the people who went before us, tapping out messages from the past, from beyond the grave, trying to tell us about life and death! Listen to them! Connie Willis

sadness.quote: When people don’t express themselves, they die one piece at a time
sadness.author: Laurie Halse Anderson

sadness.quote: Life is for the living. Death is for the dead. Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid
sadness.author: Langston Hughes

sadness.quote: Give place to others, as others have given place to you. Equality is the soul of equity
sadness.author: Who can complain of being comprehended in the same destiny, wherein all are involved? Michel de Montaigne

sadness.quote: It is the fate — the genetic and neural fate — of every human being to be a unique individual, to find his own path, to live his own life, to die his own death
sadness.author: Oliver Sacks

sadness.quote: Man always thinks about the past before he dies, as if he were frantically searching for proof that he truly lived
sadness.author: Jet Black

sadness.quote: It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it’s called Life
sadness.author: Terry Pratchett

sadness.quote: Do not seek death. Death will find you. But seek the road which makes death a fulfillment
sadness.author: Dag Hammarskjold

sadness.quote: Since we’re all going to die, it’s obvious that when and how don’t matter
sadness.author: Albert Camus

sadness.quote: Death comes to all, but great achievements build a monument which shall endure until the sun grows cold
sadness.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

sadness.quote: One small revenge might be to die and show no signs of having died
sadness.author: Julian Barnes

sadness.quote: The pain of yesterday is the strength of today
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho

sadness.quote: A man is not hurt so much by what happens, as by his opinion of what happens
sadness.author: Michel de Montaigne

sadness.quote: The worst loss you’ve ever experienced is the greatest gift you can have
sadness.author: Byron Katie

sadness.quote: Choose not to be harmed – and you won’t feel harmed. Don’t feel harmed – and you haven’t been
sadness.author: Marcus Aurelius

sadness.quote: If it hurts it’s probably doing you good. If it’s pleasant, it’s most likely wrong
sadness.author: John Graves

sadness.quote: Even situations that appear to be obstacles are actually opportunities – detours in the right direction
sadness.author: Gabby Bernstein

sadness.quote: Just because it’s not what you were expecting, doesn’t mean it’s not everything you need right now
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho

sadness.quote: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift
sadness.author: Mary Oliver

sadness.quote: The moment you accept what troubles you’ve been given, the door will open
sadness.author: Rumi

sadness.quote: What if the worst thing that happened to you turns out to be the best thing that has ever happened to you?
sadness.author: Joe Dispenza

sadness.quote: It does not matter what you bear, but how you bear it
sadness.author: Seneca

sadness.quote: I’m not upset that you lied to me, I’m upset that from now on I can’t believe you
sadness.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

sadness.quote: Live. Understand. Move on
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: To heal a wound you must stop scratching it
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho

sadness.quote: Never to suffer would never to have been blessed
sadness.author: Edgar Allan Poe

sadness.quote: Despair can never be dissolved through escape, but by observing it
sadness.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

sadness.quote: Pain is inevitable, suffering is not
sadness.author: Henepola Gunaratana

sadness.quote: Be grateful in spite of your suffering
sadness.author: Jordan Peterson

sadness.quote: The purpose of life, as far as I can tell… is to find a mode of being that’s so meaningful that the fact that life is suffering is no longer relevant
sadness.author: Jordan Peterson (Maps of Meaning)

sadness.quote: Another person will not hurt you without your cooperation. You are hurt the moment you believe yourself to be
sadness.author: Epictetus

sadness.quote: So other people hurt me? That’s their problem. Their character and actions are not mine. What is done to me is ordained by nature, what I do by my own
sadness.author: Marcus Aurelius

sadness.quote: When there is no resistance of any kind then there is no psychological problem
sadness.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

sadness.quote: Accept suffering and achieve atonement through it – that is what you must do
sadness.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

sadness.quote: Better to have loved and lost, than to have never loved at all
sadness.author: Augustine of Hippo

sadness.quote: You aren’t really being rejected – you’re being redirected
sadness.author: Mel Robbins

sadness.quote: Many things cause pain which would cause pleasure if you regarded their advantages
sadness.author: Baltasar Gracián

sadness.quote: A fountain gets muddy with but little stirring up, and does not get clear by our meddling with it but by our leaving it alone. The best remedy for disturbances is to let them run their course, for so they quiet down
sadness.author: Baltasar Gracián

sadness.quote: Injuries done to us by others tend to be acute; the self-inflicted ones tend to be chronic
sadness.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb (The Bed of Procrustes)

sadness.quote: And once the storm is over, you won’t remember how you made it through, how you managed to survive. You won’t even be sure, whether the storm is really over. But one thing is certain. When you come out of the storm, you won’t be the same person who walked in
sadness.author: Haruki Murakami

sadness.quote: The avoidance of suffering is a form of suffering. The avoidance of struggle is a struggle. Hiding what is shameful is itself a form of shame
sadness.author: Mark Manson

sadness.quote: It is in dialogue with pain that many beautiful things acquire their value
sadness.author: Alain de Botton (The Architecture of Happiness)

sadness.quote: Just because someone serves you a bad meal, does not mean you have to eat it
sadness.author: George Raveling

sadness.quote: Part 1. Life will have terrible blows, horrible blows, unfair blows, doesn’t matter. And some people recover and others don’t
sadness.author: Charlie Munger

sadness.quote: Part 2. I think the attitude of Epictetus is the best. He thought that every mischance in life was an opportunity to behave well, every mischance in life was an opportunity to learn something, and your duty was not to be submerged in self-pity but to utilize the terrible blow in a constructive fashion
sadness.author: Charlie Munger

sadness.quote: If you ignore a deep wound, it gets infected. Same is true of psychological wounds. You have to treat a wound to heal it
sadness.author: Neil Strauss

sadness.quote: If you evade suffering you also evade the chance of joy. Pleasure you may get, or pleasures, but you will not be fulfilled. You will not know what it is to come home. Ursula K
sadness.author: Le Guin (The Dispossessed)

sadness.quote: Oh, love isn’t there to make us happy. I believe it exists to show us how much we can endure
sadness.author: Hermann Hesse

sadness.quote: No man is hurt but by himself
sadness.author: Diogenes

sadness.quote: Step out of the history that is holding you back. Step into the new story you are willing to create
sadness.author: Oprah Winfrey

sadness.quote: We need never be ashamed of our tears
sadness.author: Charles Dickens

sadness.quote: Truth is everybody is going to hurt you: you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for
sadness.author: Bob Marley

sadness.quote: Nothing on earth consumes a man more quickly than the passion of resentment
sadness.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

sadness.quote: Handling our suffering is an art. If we know how to suffer, we suffer much less, and we’re no longer afraid of being overwhelmed by the suffering inside
sadness.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

sadness.quote: In the Now, in the absence of time, all your problems dissolve. Suffering needs time; it cannot survive in the Now
sadness.author: Eckhart Tolle

sadness.quote: Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge
sadness.author: Eckhart Tolle

sadness.quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality
sadness.author: Seneca

sadness.quote: Suffering is part of our training program for becoming wise
sadness.author: Ram Dass

sadness.quote: God allows us to experience the low points of life in order to teach us lessons that we could learn in no other way. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis

sadness.quote: Sometimes your heart needs more time to accept something that your mind already knows
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho

sadness.quote: I began to understand that suffering and disappointments and melancholy are there not to vex us or cheapen us or deprive us of our dignity but to mature and transfigure us
sadness.author: Hermann Hesse (Peter Camenzind)

sadness.quote: I hurt myself today, to see if I still feel. I focus on the pain, the only thing that’s real
sadness.author: Johnny Cash

sadness.quote: If you see somebody that’s hurting, don’t look away. And if you are hurting, even though it might be hard, try to find that bravery within yourself to dive deep and go tell somebody
sadness.author: Lady Gaga (Grammys 2019)

sadness.quote: To hurt is as human as to breathe. J.K
sadness.author: Rowling

sadness.quote: Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them
sadness.author: Leo Tolstoy

sadness.quote: If there was no suffering, man would not know his limits, would not know himself
sadness.author: Leo Tolstoy (War and Peace)

sadness.quote: Embrace your suffering tenderly
sadness.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

sadness.quote: It is when we hurt that we learn
sadness.author: Steve Maraboli

sadness.quote: No one can hurt me – that’s my job
sadness.author: Byron Katie

sadness.quote: Heaven or hell; it’s all in the mind. D
sadness.author: Muthukrishnan

sadness.quote: Only in ending is there a new beginning
sadness.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

sadness.quote: We cannot learn without experiencing pain
sadness.author: Unknown

sadness.quote: How you relate to the issue *is* the issue
sadness.author: Ron Hulnick

sadness.quote: Today’s hot pain is tomorrow’s cold wisdom
sadness.author: @TheStoicEmperor

sadness.quote: It doesn’t hurt to feel sad from time to time
sadness.author: Willie Nelson

sadness.quote: The axe never remembers. The tree never forgets
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho

sadness.quote: What hurts you, blesses you. Darkness is your candle
sadness.author: Rumi

sadness.quote: The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves
sadness.author: Sophocles

sadness.quote: Pain doesn’t hurt as much when you stop avoiding it
sadness.author: Mel Robbins

sadness.quote: Whatever rejection you’re facing right now is a gift
sadness.author: Mel Robbins

sadness.quote: Failure hurts but passes quickly. Regret hurts forever
sadness.author: Shane Parrish

sadness.quote: No one and nothing can free you but your own understanding
sadness.author: Ajahn Chah

sadness.quote: Stop running from pain. Pain is here to teach you something
sadness.author: Justin Kan

sadness.quote: People need hard times and oppression to develop psychic muscles
sadness.author: Emily Dickinson

sadness.quote: We are not our stories, our dramas, or our wrongdoings. We are love
sadness.author: Gabby Bernstein (Judgment Detox)

sadness.quote: Don’t allow your wounds to turn you into a person you are not
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho

sadness.quote: When jarred, unavoidably, by circumstances, revert at once to yourself, and don’t lose the rhythm more than you can help. You’ll have a better grasp of harmony if you keep on going back to it
sadness.author: Marcus Aurelius

sadness.quote: I’ve survived a lot of things, and I’ll probably survive this. J. D
sadness.author: Salinger

sadness.quote: When another person makes you suffer, it is because he suffers deeply within himself, and his suffering is spilling over. He does not need punishment; he needs help. That’s the message he is sending

sadness.quote: The more unloving a person behaves, the greater is their need for love and healing
sadness.author: Iyanla Vanzant

sadness.author: Thibaut

sadness.author: Augustine of Hippo

sadness.author: Alain de Botton (Status Anxiety, Amazon book)

sadness.author: Simon Van Booy

sadness.quote: The absence of love and belonging will always lead to suffering

sadness.quote: Your unhealed wounds speak the loudest when triggered

sadness.quote: Sometimes the most toxic relationship is between you and your inner wounded child

sadness.quote: Heal so you can feel what love without trauma feels like

sadness.quote: What is thoroughly understood will not repeat itself
sadness.author: Jiddu Krishnamruti

sadness.quote: Remember what your failures taught you. Forget how your failures made you feel
sadness.author: James Clear

sadness.quote: Everything changes once we identify with being the witness to the story, instead of the actor in it
sadness.author: Ram Dass

sadness.author: Jed McKenna

sadness.author: Anthony de Mello

sadness.author: James Pierce

sadness.quote: Experiences are with you one moment, and gone the next. It is wise not to cling to them

sadness.quote: External things can always be taken away. If your happiness depends upon having them, that too can be taken away
sadness.author: James Pierce

sadness.quote: Heal so you can feel what love without trauma feels like
sadness.author: Boii McCoy

sadness.quote: If anyone is unhappy, remember that his unhappiness is his own fault. Nothing else is the cause of anxiety or loss of tranquility except our own opinion
sadness.author: Epictetus

sadness.quote: The best thing you can do for society is to take care of yourself first
sadness.author: @orangebook_

sadness.quote: Problems that remain persistently insoluble should always be suspected as questions asked in the wrong way
sadness.author: Alan Watts

sadness.quote: Accept everything which happens, even if it seems disagreeable, because it leads to this, the health of the universe
sadness.author: Marcus Aurelius

sadness.quote: You won’t get to the future you want if you don’t understand the present you’re in
sadness.author: @orangebook_

sadness.quote: No words or explanations can open the door. What will open the door is daily awareness and attention – awareness of how we speak, what we say, how we walk, what we think
sadness.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

sadness.quote: When instead of reacting against a situation, you merge with it, the solution arises out of the situation itself
sadness.author: Eckhart Tolle

sadness.quote: All that happens to us, including our humiliations, our misfortunes, our embarrassments, all is given to us as raw material, as clay, so that we may shape our art
sadness.author: Jorge Luis Borges

sadness.quote: Something still exists as long as there’s someone around to remember it
sadness.author: Jodi Picoult (Nineteen Minutes)

sadness.quote: Embrace your grief. For there, your soul will grow
sadness.author: Carl Jung

sadness.quote: Life is full of grief, to exactly the degree we allow ourselves to love other people
sadness.author: Orson Scott Card

sadness.quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don’t resist them – that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like
sadness.author: Lao Tzu

sadness.quote: Relax. One bad chapter does not mean it’s the end of the book
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho

sadness.quote: No one is actually dead until the ripples they cause in the world die away
sadness.author: Terry Pratchett

sadness.quote: Don’t cry because it’s over, smile because it happened
sadness.author: Ludwig Jacobowski

sadness.quote: People just disappear sometimes. You have to love and appreciate them while they’re near you
sadness.author: Haruki Murakami

sadness.quote: There are times when explanations, no matter how reasonable, just don’t seem to help
sadness.author: Fred Rogers

sadness.quote: This is not the life you pictured but here you are. You can still make something beautiful. Grieve. Breathe. Begin again
sadness.author: Thema Bryant-Davis

sadness.quote: No one feels another’s grief, no one understands another’s joy. People imagine that they can reach one another. In reality they only pass each other by
sadness.author: Franz Schubert

sadness.quote: Death is a reminder to live fully
sadness.author: Ram Dass

sadness.quote: Reality hurts when you fight it. It makes you strong when you accept it
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: It’s an honor to be in grief. It’s an honor to feel that much, to have loved that much
sadness.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

sadness.quote: How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard
sadness.author: Winnie the Pooh

sadness.quote: The art of life is not controlling what happens to us, but using what happens to us
sadness.author: Gloria Steinem

sadness.quote: Thought is time, time is sorrow
sadness.author: Jiddu Krishnmaurti

sadness.quote: How much more damage anger and grief do than the things that cause them
sadness.author: Marcus Aurelius

sadness.quote: It is not impermanence that makes us suffer. What makes us suffer is wanting things to be permanent, when they are not
sadness.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

sadness.quote: Her absence is like the sky, spread over everything. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis (A Grief Observed, Amazon book)

sadness.quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear. I am not afraid, but the sensation is like being afraid. The same fluttering in the stomach, the same restlessness, the yawning. I keep on swallowing. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis (A Grief Observed)

sadness.quote: At other times it feels like being mildly drunk, or concussed. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis (A Grief Observed)

sadness.quote: Grief, I’ve learned, is really just love. It’s all the love you want to give, but cannot. All that unspent love gathers up in the corners of your eyes, the lump in your throat, and in that hollow part of your chest. Grief is just love with no place to go
sadness.author: Jamie Anderson

sadness.quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars, the deeper the grief, the closer is God
sadness.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky (Crime and Punishment)

sadness.quote: Don’t grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form
sadness.author: Rumi

sadness.quote: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again
sadness.author: Charles Dickens

sadness.quote: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?
sadness.author: Jodi Picoult (My Sister’s Keeper, Amazon book)

sadness.quote: We run from grief because loss scares us, yet our hearts reach toward grief because the broken parts want to mend
sadness.author: Brené Brown

sadness.quote: True that we don’t know what we’ve got till we lose it, but also true that we don’t know what we’ve been missing until it arrives
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho (Hippie)

sadness.quote: Die each day; die each day to yourself, to your misery, to your sorrow; put aside that burden so that your mind is fresh, young and innocent
sadness.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

sadness.quote: People generally don’t change unless a traumatic event occurs in their life which triggers the brain into new action
sadness.author: Jordan Peterson

sadness.quote: Anyone who has lost something they thought was theirs forever finally comes to realize that nothing really belongs to them
sadness.author: Paulo Coelho

sadness.quote: Grief is tremendous, but love is bigger. You are grieving because you loved truly
sadness.author: Cheryl Strayed

sadness.quote: Dark is the atmosphere. Hopeful you must be
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: Tears are words the heart can’t express
sadness.author: Unknown (See also: sad quotes)

sadness.quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad
sadness.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

sadness.quote: When someone we love dies, we get so busy mourning what died that we ignore what didn’t
sadness.author: Ram Dass

sadness.quote: Joy is rejoicing what is, and sorrow is craving for what isn’t
sadness.author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar

sadness.quote: It’s ok to grieve, it’s a form of love
sadness.author: Naval Ravikant

sadness.quote: It’s hard to explain so much pain
sadness.author: John Lennon

sadness.quote: Grief is the price we pay for love
sadness.author: Queen Elizabeth II

sadness.quote: The things which hurt, instruct
sadness.author: Benjamin Franklin

sadness.quote: Those who are attached to things will suffer greatly
sadness.author: Lao Tzu (Tao Te Ching, Amazon book)

sadness.quote: Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted
sadness.author: Matthew 5:4

sadness.quote: I see people, as they approach me, trying to make up their minds whether they’ll ‘say something about it’ or not. I hate if they do, and if they don’t. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis (A Grief Observed)

sadness.quote: People talk as if grief were just a feeling – as if it weren’t the continually renewed shock of setting out again and again on familiar roads and being brought up short by the grim frontier post that now blocks them. C. S
sadness.author: Lewis

sadness.quote: The death of a beloved is an amputation. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis (A Grief Observed)

sadness.quote: Time is the wisest counsellor of all
sadness.author: Pericles

sadness.quote: To weep is to make less the depth of grief
sadness.author: William Shakespeare

sadness.quote: From craving is born grief, from craving is born fear
sadness.author: For one freed from craving there’s no grief – so how fear? Buddha

sadness.quote: He is a sane man who can have tragedy in his heart and comedy in his head. G.K
sadness.author: Chesterton (Tremendous Trifles)

sadness.quote: We must learn to suffer whatever we cannot avoid. Our life is composed, like the harmony of the world, of discords as well as different tones, sweet and harsh, sharp and flat, soft and loud
sadness.author: Michel de Montaigne

sadness.quote: The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair, and though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater. J.R.R
sadness.author: Tolkien

sadness.quote: People keep asking me how I’m doing, and I’m not always sure how to answer that. It depends on the day. It depends on the minute. Right this moment, I’m OK. Yesterday, not so good. Tomorrow, we’ll see
sadness.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

sadness.quote: On Kobe Bryant’s death: Tragedies like this have a cruel way of reminding us of what’s important in life: spending time with our loved ones, and being there for them no matter what
sadness.author: Derek Jeter

sadness.quote: On Kobe Bryant’s death: I haven’t felt a pain that sharp in a while… I just wish I could say something to him
sadness.author: Shaquille O’Neal

sadness.quote: When you are sorrowful, look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight
sadness.author: Kahlil Gibran (The Prophet, Amazon book)

sadness.quote: When you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy
sadness.author: Kahlil Gibran (The Prophet)

sadness.quote: Pure and complete sorrow is as impossible as pure and complete joy
sadness.author: Leo Tolstoy (War and Peace)

sadness.quote: You don’t know who is important to you until you actually lose them
sadness.author: Mahatma Gandhi

sadness.quote: Those who do not weep, do not see
sadness.author: Victor Hugo

sadness.quote: Life is a blink
sadness.author: Hoda Kotb

sadness.quote: Grief is itself a medicine
sadness.author: William Cowper

sadness.quote: Tearless grief bleeds inwardly
sadness.author: Christian Nevell Bovee

sadness.quote: Loss is not as bad as wanting more
sadness.author: Lao Tzu (Tao Te Ching)

sadness.quote: Make peace with the present moment
sadness.author: Eckhart Tolle

sadness.quote: We need never be ashamed of our tears
sadness.author: Charles Dickens

sadness.quote: Life is a movie; death is a photograph
sadness.author: Susan Sontag

sadness.quote: Grief is just love with no place to go
sadness.author: Kaushani Banerjee

sadness.quote: Life is unfair. Death is natural. Accept
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: The greater the love the greater the grief. C.S

sadness.quote: Bear without murmuring what cannot be changed
sadness.author: Publius Syrus

sadness.quote: A man may win many battles, but death will win the war
sadness.author: James Pierce

sadness.quote: After you grieve what could have been, prepare for what can be
sadness.author: Thema Bryant-Davis

sadness.quote: Your wounded heart is a very beautiful heart
sadness.author: Fred Rogers

sadness.quote: I do not believe that grief is ever so great that it can not be contained within
sadness.author: Judith McNaught

sadness.quote: Go beyond love and grief, exist for the good of mankind
sadness.author: Miyamoto Musashi

sadness.quote: The road continues, there are still pages to read, sunrises to see and mountains to conquer. Don’t give up
sadness.author: Maxime Lagacé

sadness.quote: No matter who you are, no matter where you are, gratitude can dissolve all negativity in your life, regardless of what form it has taken
sadness.author: Rhonda Byrne

sadness.author: Rhonda Byrne

sadness.author: Henri Nouwen

sadness.quote: I love the man that can smile in trouble, that can gather strength from distress and grow brave by reflection. ‘Tis the business of little minds to shrink; but he whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves his conduct, will pursue his principles unto death
sadness.author: Thomas Paine

sadness.quote: On the occasion of every accident (event) that befalls you, remember to turn to yourself and inquire what power you have for turning it to use
sadness.author: Epictetus (Enchiridion, Amazon book)

sadness.quote: Whenever sorrow comes, be kind to it. For God has placed a pearl in sorrow’s hand
sadness.author: Rumi

sadness.quote: Be content with the moment and be willing to follow the flow; then there will be no room for grief or joy
sadness.author: Zhuangzi

sadness.quote: When we lose one blessing, another is often most unexpectedly given in its place. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis

sadness.quote: Grief is like a long valley, a winding valley where any bend may reveal a totally new landscape. C.S
sadness.author: Lewis (A Grief Observed)

sadness.quote: After the grieving, the gift of life shows up reminding us why we’re still here

sadness.author: Thema Bryant-Davis

sadness.quote: Beyond death there is resurection. Beyond grief, there is joy
